intro: Pilosella sanii, commonly known as the San Juan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually yellow with a central disk. Pilosella sanii is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils.
